moves.3... e6 4. Bxc4: white makes sure that he fully controls the center, half the battle is won
moves.6. Nf3 Bxc3+ 7. bxc3: white still has the center, but black should have taken the pawn on e4
moves.7... Nc6 8. Bf4: still black does not see the free pawn on e4
moves.8... O-O 9. d5: if i was playing white, i would castle first before attacking
moves.9... exd5 10. exd5 Re8+ 11. Be3: still looks good for white, he manages to cover his king
moves.13... Nxd5 14. Bg5: good attacking bishop, remember this words ... the best defense is to attack
moves.14... f6 15. Bd2: i would have moved bishop to h4
moves.15... Bg4 16. Bd3: not sure why his bishop is on d3
moves.16... c6 17. c4: black's knight on d5 looks dangerous. it was wise to chase the knight away
moves.17... Bxf3 18. Qxf3: good exchange and white has the advantage
moves.18... b6: b6 ?? he should have moved his knight from d5
moves.21. Qxf6 Rf7: only a matter of time before white attacks
moves.22. Qe6 Nb7: good pin and black knight is coming to help with the defense
moves.23. Bh6 Nc5 24. Qh3: white should have moved his queen to g5 and threaten to take g6 with bishop sacrifice
moves.24... Qf6 25. Bb5: white bishop on b5 is passive
moves.25... Ne4 26. f3: f3 is a bad move, i would have chosen Qe3 or even Be3
moves.26... Nd2: Bxd2 is the correct move. too bad white did not spend more time analsying the position
moves.27. Rf2 Qxa1+: its time for white to resign
moves.31. Qg2 Rxf1+ 32. Qxf1 Re1: white cannot survive and with the lost of the queen, he should resign
moves.33. Qxe1 Qxe1+ 34. Kg2: hopeless ... should resign and fight again another day
